Body:
I am working on an IR based remote control app using arduino. After a long exploration i found few Raw Ir codes, which looks like - 

IR": "40064
column88:
5128" enter code here

And it's very sad that even after getting this code i am unable to understand this code
column89:
I am using this aruino library - https://github.com/z3t0/Arduino-IRremote

where for sending raw codes is like this - 

void  IRsend::sendRaw (const unsigned int buf[]
column91:
unsigned int hz){ // Set IR carrier frequency enableIROut(hz); for (unsigned int i = 0; i < len; i++) { if (i & 1) space(buf[i]) ; else mark (buf[i]) ; } space(0); // Always end with the LED off }

Where buf is an array containing intervals in microseconds during which signal will be low or high. But the IR code i got above isn't working
column92:
because i think it's not having the time intervals but something else. Any lead would be gracious.

"

Body: is the IR LED pulsing the codes? (you can use a digital camera to check)

I was working on the same project this summer and I found that TSOP calibration is extremely crucial. Make sure you use the exact TSOP sensor for this experiment. I have noticed many times, the values that you copy from the serial monitor has problems. Good luck!
@marshmellooooooos, Thank you, I know it's not much reliable, but good for a trial. Bdw, i figured out a temporary solution for this.
